definition[0]: to feel or express great surprise or admiration at something, especially someone’s behaviour
example[0]: ‘The man is a genius, ’ marvelled Claire.
example[1]: I marvelled at my mother’s ability to remain calm in a crisis.
example[2]: Visitors to Rome marvel over the beauty of the city.
example[3]: I marvelled that anyone could be so stupid.
definition[1]: something or someone that is extremely useful or skilful
example[5]: I don’t know how he did it – he’s an absolute marvel!
